comment.author: 48982730@N00
comment._content: This view is across George St at Hay St, looking East from outside what is now a Westpac bank.  Light rail runs across here now (along Hay St).

comment.author: 35672655@N00
comment._content:
the tall building behind the cnr bank was the 7storey AMICO HOUSE built 1890.It was the 3rd of 4 bldgs built by Horderns.
It housed all the ironmongery departments. A further 3 storeys was added after Horden sold the premises & it was finally demolished in 1973. The site remains undeveloped.

comment.author: 97844002@N00
comment._content: i try to sharpen here -- Seen in some comments. (?)"Steet life" by photocomix-mandala [?]

comment.author: 40309464@N00
comment._content: Hi, I'm an admin for a group called Old Photos City Scenes B&W, and we'd love to have this added to the group!

comment.author: 40309464@N00
comment._content: What strikes me are the communication wires cutting across the scene, the indicator truly of the modernization of the city... still horses and wagons yet telecommunications (telegraph?). Advertising is prominent in the public sphere of the growing city, using available space... looks so odd the way the name is painted on that addition  over the beautiful most modern building there.

comment.author: 35672655@N00
comment._content: ^most highrise only has main street frontage ,so that facade was detailed/ornate, but sides and rear were blank, thus perfect spot to place advertising.

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: The poster for the "Grand Commonwealth Fair" occurs in several pictures of George Street, implying they must be contemporary to the event at the Town Hall in November / December 1899. The trams on this part of George St started in December 1899. See other pictures www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/2712341239/ and www.flickr.com/photos/powerhouse_museum/3023707402/

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Haymarket Permanent Land Building & Investment Co building, George St...evidently built ca. 1888-1889 - see item in Sydney Mail 23/3/1889 - news.google.com/newspapers?id=97hPAAAAIBAJ&sjid=T5MDA...

comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content: GoogleMapsStreetView - remarkably this corner of Sydney has not changed a great deal in 110 years. Except the trams run in the opposite direction!
